method.name: Intuitionistic Fuzzy K-Nearest Neighbors classifier

reference.ref: L. I. Kuncheva, An intuitionistic fuzzy k-nearest neighbors rule, Notes on Intuitionistic Fuzzy Sets, vol. 1, pp. 56-60, 1995.

generalDescription.howWork: In IF-KNN, Intuitionistic fuzzy sets are incorporated into the voting rule, where votes are weighted using the concepts of membership and nonmembership to a certain class: If the membership of a voting instance is above a lower threshold and the nonmembership below a higher threshold , the vote is considered as positive. On the other hand, if the nonmembership of a voting instance is above a lower threshold and the membership is below a positive threshold, the vote is considered as negative. Otherwise, the vote is null.

parameterSpec.param: K value: K parameter in the k-NN rule.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: IF_KNN-C Dataset: appendicitis Test Show results: Vis-Clas-Check Parameters: Default settings
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the Vis-Clas-Check results' file the classification results for the test set:
